alert.note: Alert for Martin; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Martin and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart, White City, Saint Lucie Nuclear Power Plant, Fort Pierce Inlet, Indrio, Jensen Beach, Palm City, Port Saint Lucie River Park, Fort Pierce South, Indian River Estates, Saint Lucie West, Fort Pierce North, Saint Lucie Airport, Tradition, Saint Lucie Village, Nettles Island and Queens Cove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
